com.opengamma.strata.market.value

Interface IborIndexRates

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DiscountIborIndexRates

    public interface IborIndexRates
    Provides access to rates for an Ibor index.

    This provides historic and forward rates for a single IborIndex, such as 'GBP-LIBOR-3M'.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CurveCurrencyParameterSensitivities curveParameterSensitivity(IborRateSensitivity pointSensitivity)
      Calculates the curve parameter sensitivity from the point sensitivity.
      CurveName getCurveName()
      Gets the name of the underlying curve.
      IborIndex getIndex()
      Gets the Ibor index.
      int getParameterCount()
      Gets the number of parameters defining the curve.
      LocalDateDoubleTimeSeries getTimeSeries()
      Gets the time-series of fixings for the index.
      LocalDate getValuationDate()
      Gets the valuation date.
      double rate(LocalDate fixingDate)
      Gets the historic or forward rate at the specified fixing date.
      PointSensitivityBuilder ratePointSensitivity(LocalDate fixingDate)
      Calculates the point sensitivity of the historic or forward rate at the specified fixing date.
      CurveUnitParameterSensitivities unitParameterSensitivity(LocalDate fixingDate)
      Calculates the unit parameter sensitivity of the forward rate at the specified fixing date.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        IborIndex getIndex()
        Gets the Ibor index.

        The index that the rates are for.

        Returns:
        the Ibor index

      • getValuationDate

        LocalDate getValuationDate()
        Gets the valuation date.

        The raw data in this provider is calibrated for this date.

        Returns:
        the valuation date

      • getTimeSeries

        LocalDateDoubleTimeSeries getTimeSeries()
        Gets the time-series of fixings for the index.

        The time-series contains historic fixings of the index. It may be empty if the data is not available.

        Returns:
        the time-series fixings

      • getCurveName

        CurveName getCurveName()
        Gets the name of the underlying curve.
        Returns:
        the underlying curve name

      • getParameterCount

        int getParameterCount()
        Gets the number of parameters defining the curve.

        If the curve has no parameters, zero must be returned.

        Returns:
        the number of parameters

      • rate

        double rate(LocalDate fixingDate)
        Gets the historic or forward rate at the specified fixing date.

        The rate of the Ibor index, such as 'GBP-LIBOR-3M', varies over time. This method obtains the actual or estimated rate for the fixing date.

        This retrieves the actual rate if the fixing date is before the valuation date, or the estimated rate if the fixing date is after the valuation date. If the fixing date equals the valuation date, then the best available rate is returned.

        Parameters:
        fixingDate - the fixing date to query the rate for
        Returns:
        the rate of the index, either historic or forward
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the value cannot be obtained

      • ratePointSensitivity

        PointSensitivityBuilder ratePointSensitivity(LocalDate fixingDate)
        Calculates the point sensitivity of the historic or forward rate at the specified fixing date.

        This returns a sensitivity instance referring to the curve used to determine the forward rate. If a time-series was used, then there is no sensitivity. The sensitivity refers to the result of rate(LocalDate).

        Parameters:
        fixingDate - the fixing date to find the sensitivity for
        Returns:
        the point sensitivity of the rate
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the result cannot be calculated

      • unitParameterSensitivity

        CurveUnitParameterSensitivities unitParameterSensitivity(LocalDate fixingDate)
        Calculates the unit parameter sensitivity of the forward rate at the specified fixing date.

        This returns the unit sensitivity to each parameter on the underlying curve at the specified date. The sensitivity refers to the result of rate(LocalDate).

        Parameters:
        fixingDate - the fixing date to find the sensitivity for
        Returns:
        the parameter sensitivity
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the value cannot be obtained

      • curveParameterSensitivity

        CurveCurrencyParameterSensitivities curveParameterSensitivity(IborRateSensitivity pointSensitivity)
        Calculates the curve parameter sensitivity from the point sensitivity.

        This is used to convert a single point sensitivity to curve parameter sensitivity. The calculation typically involves multiplying the point and unit sensitivities.

        Parameters:
        pointSensitivity - the point sensitivity to convert
        Returns:
        the parameter sensitivity
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the result cannot be calculated
